content:
A user has suggested making a rounded square icon for Zulip to match others in the bottom app bar on a Mac. Is that easy to do? Should we do that? The user's patch produces the following (we don't have to do it exactly this way, of course):

Screen-Shot-2022-12-12-at-3.53.07-PM.png
We could just extend the blue background rather than putting a box around a round logo if we wanted.
Tangentially this would also resolve the icon discussion from the Mastodon thread weeks back, where https://fosstodon.org/@zulip has a circular icon in a square frame.
Was that in a public stream? Couldn't find it in all public streams here.

We have a square variant of the icon; I would generally expect to use that rather than putting a white border around a circular icon.

zulip-icon-square.svg
Hmm I guess we don't preview SVGs, but it's in here: https://github.com/zulip/zulip/tree/main/static/images/logo.
Filed #D1253. I don't think I have the bits to mark it as "help wanted".
